steps.title: Follow these steps to make the agent operational:

faststore.title: FastStore

faststore.step1: Go to the GitHub repository and paste the code below into the `thirdpartyscripts.tsx` file

portal.title: Portal/Layout
portal.description: Follow these steps to make the agent operational:
portal.step1: In the VTEX Admin, go to Storefront > Layout.
portal.step3: Click HTML Templates, then Sub Templates.
portal.step4: Open `commonScripts` and paste the script below.

site_editor.description: No configuration steps are required for stores using 'Site Editor'. Once confirmed, the agent will be ready to use.

details.title: Smart agents
details.description: Enhance your smart agents by enabling control over conversation flows based on user intent. With the Starter Plan, you can customize language, tone, and behavior to give your agent a unique identity and improve communication quality. See the exchanges and returns agent demo on the side.

objective.title: Objective (optional)
objective.default: Its goal is to answer customer questions, share order status updates, provide product information, and support sales. Key features include shopping via WhatsApp and an integrated FAQ.

knowledge.title: Knowledge base
knowledge.context: Provide the source of the content your agent will use to answer the questions

terms.title: Terms and Conditions
terms.description1: VTEX and the Contractor have entered into a Master Service Agreement ("Agreement") to establish the authorization for use, as well as the provision of support and maintenance services, for the software developed by VTEX for ecommerce solutions. VTEX and the Contractor are hereinafter referred to collectively as the "Parties" and individually as a "Party".
terms.description2: The Admin Master ("Owner (Admin Super)") of the Contractor on the VTEX Platform, duly authorized to act on behalf of the Contractor with full powers and obligations related to this authorization, hereby accepts and acknowledges the provisions of these Terms and Conditions — Weni by VTEX Platform ("T&C"), binding the Parties and their successors to be governed, under any circumstances, by the following clauses:

description.1: 1.1 VTEX, through the Weni by VTEX Platform, offers a service to support the Contractor in communicating with their clients via widely used messaging channels, including but not limited to WhatsApp, SMS, and Webchat.
description.2: 1.2 Subject to the conditions set forth in these T&C, VTEX shall provide the Contractor with a non-exclusive right to access and use the Weni by VTEX Platform for internal business purposes.

description.1: 2.1 The Contractor shall be responsible for the entire content of all communications sent by their users through the Weni by VTEX Platform, as well as for ensuring compliance with all applicable laws and regulations related to the activities performed.
description.2: 2.2 The Contractor expressly agrees to update their policies and terms of use, and to obtain the express consent of their consumers, where applicable, for sending service-related information through communication channels such as email, SMS, WhatsApp, and others, thereby releasing VTEX from any liability in this regard.
description.3: 2.3 The Contractor acknowledges and agrees to the WhatsApp Business Solution Terms, available at https://www.whatsapp.com/legal/meta-terms-whatsapp-business, including any future updates. The Contractor further acknowledges that they may not use the Weni by VTEX Platform to track or create individual user profiles for any business entity; to track, create, sell, or distribute any data derived from the Weni by VTEX Platform; or to engage in any actions prohibited by the applicable terms established by Meta, the company that maintains the WhatsApp Business solution.

description.1: 3.1 Provided that the Contractor fulfills its obligations, VTEX commits to keeping the Weni by VTEX Platform services operational at least 99% of the time each month. The Parties agree that any non-compliance with the Service Level Agreement (SLA) due to instabilities from Meta or other involved third parties are excluded. The SLA ("Measured SLA") is calculated by taking the total minutes in the analyzed month and subtracting any recorded downtime during that period. Downtime refers to periods when the Weni by VTEX Platform is not accessible and usable by the Contractor and other internet connections, excluding cases of (1) planned maintenance, (2) events of force majeure, or (3) problems arising from improper use of the Weni by VTEX Platform by the Contractor or proven failure to fulfill their obligations.
description.2: 3.2 If the SLA is not met as described above, provided that the Contractor has fulfilled all their obligations, VTEX shall grant service credits in an amount equal to 10% (ten percent) of the Contractor's monthly payments for the Weni by VTEX Platform to VTEX. These credits will be applied to the next invoice issued after the downtime calculation. To receive service credits, the Contractor must submit a request through the VTEX Support system within ten (10) days following the end of the month in which the downtime occurred, in accordance with the terms established in the Agreement between the Parties.

description.1: 4.1 The Parties agree that the modules included in the Weni Platform by VTEX are: Flows Module; Studio Module; Artificial Intelligence Module; Integration Module; Chat Module; SDK for mobile applications; WhatsApp Business API; and Unlimited agent license for Weni Chat.
description.2: 4.2 The Parties agree that the services and support included in the Weni by VTEX Platform comprise: the creation of an environment on the Weni Platform; hosting of the Weni Platform; up to six (6) hours of training; updates and improvements to the Weni by VTEX Platform; and support.

contracting.title: 5. Terms and parameters of the agreement

description.1: 5.1 The Parties agree that the platform will be presented to the Contractor within five (5) business days following payment of the annual license fee, provided that the Contractor has provided VTEX with the necessary contact information.
description.2: 5.2 The Parties agree that the project shall commence after payment of the annual license fee.
description.3: 5.3 The terms of these T&C shall take effect on the date of signature and remain valid for a period of twelve (12) months. The agreement will be automatically renewed for successive periods of the same duration, unless either Party notifies the other in writing, at least thirty (30) days prior to the expiration date, expressing their intention not to renew the T&C.

4.title: 5.4 These T&C can be terminated by either Party at the end of the twelve (12) month period without penalty or compensation, provided the Party wishing to terminate notifies the other Party at least ninety (90) days in advance.

items.1: 5.4.1 If the Contractor unilaterally decides to terminate the Agreement before the end of the twelve (12) month term, they shall pay VTEX the monthly contracted license fee, as set forth in clause 6.1, until the end of the twelve (12) month term established in this Section.

description.1: 6.1 The Contractor shall pay VTEX the amounts indicated in the table below, in accordance with the selected plan, upon receipt of an invoice issued by VTEX, as set forth in the Agreement.

rows.feature: Annual licensing fee (cloud hosting, services, and continuous updates)
Monthly licensing fee (maintenance, monitoring, and support)
Success rate (per customer interaction resolved by AI)
Outbound CX notifications (order tracking, invoice sending, payment notification, etc.)

description.2: 6.2 The amounts stipulated in these T&C shall be charged on the invoice issued by VTEX to the Contractor, in accordance with the payment terms established in the Agreement previously signed between the Parties.

description.1: 7.1 These T&C shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the legislation stipulated in the Agreement. Any dispute between the Parties that cannot be resolved by mutual agreement will be settled exclusively under the terms of the said Agreement.
description.2: 7.2 Any delay in payment by the Contractor exceeding fifteen (15) days shall entitle VTEX to restrict access to the solution provided through the Weni by VTEX Platform until payment of the unpaid invoices.
description.3: 7.3 The Contractor acknowledges that the Weni by VTEX Platform uses external technology platforms, including but not limited to those offered by the corporate entity Meta. The Contractor acknowledges that any changes, limitations, or suspensions of the Weni by VTEX Platform due to determinations made by the corporate entity Meta will be communicated by VTEX to the Contractor as soon as possible, even if through means other than those established in these T&C, without constituting a violation of these terms by VTEX.
description.4: 7.4 The Parties ratify all other provisions of the Agreement that have not been expressly revoked or amended by this Addendum, including those applicable to this instrument. In the event of any conflict between the Agreement and this Addendum, the provisions of this Addendum shall prevail.

terms.description: By using this application, you must accept the Terms and Conditions. These terms define access to and use of the services, detailing the features of the selected plan, its limitations, pricing, and renewal policies. They also describe the product's functionality, usage guidelines and any applicable restrictions to ensure a safe and satisfactory experience.

plan_details.title: 1. Plan details
plan_details.description: Your plan includes specific features, limitations, and billing terms. Check your subscription details to understand what it offers and how renewals work.

product_usage.title: 2. Product usage
product_usage.description: This app was developed to enhance your experience through specific features and functionalities. Any misuse, unauthorized access, or violation of the terms may result in account suspension.
